Tried this game on a free weekend with a friend who has over 500 hours on it, and instantly got hooked (excuse the pun). 

The main concept of this game is simple - you either play as a survivor or killer, survivors have to escape the killer and try not to get sacrificed (hooked 3 times) by him. Once you get into the meta though, it becomes a little bit more complicated. Alongside escaping, you are expected to ideally help your teammates, whether that be off a hook or taking a hit for them (depending on the circumstances), etc. There are also quite a few meta perks like Decisive Strike, Dead Hard, Sprint Burst etc that are OP against killers but at the same time if all 4 survivors use them it isn't fun for the killer at all. The same goes for killer meta builds, like Pop Goes The Weasel, etc. I personally haven't got burnt out yet but I will probably reach that point soon.

Another mechanic that you have to take into consideration is looping - the act of basically running around certain spots when you're getting chased by the killer to delay him killing you and by doing so buying your teammates time to do generators, etc. It's damn hard to master and while it is simple I haven't fully mastered this yet either.

All in all, you'll have much more fun in this game if you play with friends at first. Occasionally I play solo and while most lobbies are alright, expect some teammates to call you out if you're crap (e.g. one rightfully called me out for not bodyblocking the killer when I haven't been hooked once)

On a final note, what some friends and what I recommend you to do is to watch Twitch streamers that play DBD (Otzdarva is a damn good one, ANGRYPUG another). By doing that you're basically going to learn how to do things like looping, etc much faster. It did take me a while to get into the habit of watching one of them but nevertheless, I recommend it too.

This game requires a very large time investment before you can start doing well. It's more about optimizing your perks and add-ons than having any real skill which is to be expected from a party game. It's scary when you start playing as a survivor, as you don't know what's going on. But once you've played enough games to know what's going on it's more annoying than anything else when you lose. Being the killer is a lot more fun with a bunch of variety between the different ones available.
Really fun to play with friends. Ranking system doesnt apply to win/lose which is really balanced to play with.
up the ante is the best perk in the game and that is fact
